title: yoshimitsu777
author: yoshimitsu777
content: Do any of you know how low the smallest known hashrate was that landed a block hit, say in the last 3 years?

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Since we can only estimate the hash power of some mining pools and there are many unknown miners with unknown hash rate, it's impossible to answer to your question. It's possible that a solo miner has found a block with a very low hash power, but we can't know how much hash rate is owned by any of individual miners.

comments.author: BlackHatCoiner
comments.body: Do you perhaps mean what is the block that dropped the hash rate the most in the last 3 years? That's 689,472, which dropped difficulty by about 28%, from 19,932,791,027,263 to 14,363,025,673,660. Otherwise, if you're asking how many hashes it took the least to solve a block, then that's unknown. In the end, it only takes one hash to solve a block.

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: Earlier this year a Compac-F running 350GHs hit a block on the -ck solo pool. That low enough for you?

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: NotFuzzyWarm on November 16, 2022, 02:48:42 PMEarlier this year a Compac-F running 350GHs hit a block on the -ck solo pool. That low enough for you?IIRC he had about 1.75th worth of them say five sticks.Pretty good I would say.

comments.author: Sledge0001
comments.body: Quote from: philipma1957 on November 16, 2022, 03:23:14 PMQuote from: NotFuzzyWarm on November 16, 2022, 02:48:42 PMEarlier this year a Compac-F running 350GHs hit a block on the -ck solo pool. That low enough for you?IIRC he had about 1.75th worth of them say five sticks.Pretty good I would say.Actually, I hit with 9 Compac F sticks attached to a HP Omen PC... Hence the name "TheOmen" but nothing more than a simple Windows PC a few high power hubs and some USB miners.  My total BTC farm hashpower at that time was between 8.2 - 9.2Th but the system that hit was running 9 Compac F sticks totaling about 3.4-3.6TH.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: Sledge0001 on November 16, 2022, 05:37:06 PMQuote from: philipma1957 on November 16, 2022, 03:23:14 PMQuote from: NotFuzzyWarm on November 16, 2022, 02:48:42 PMEarlier this year a Compac-F running 350GHs hit a block on the -ck solo pool. That low enough for you?IIRC he had about 1.75th worth of them say five sticks.Pretty good I would say.Actually, I hit with 9 Compac F sticks attached to a HP Omen PC... Hence the name "TheOmen" but nothing more than a simple Windows PC a few high power hubs and some USB miners.  My total BTC farm hashpower at that time was between 8.2 - 9.2Th but the system that hit was running 9 Compac F sticks totaling about 3.4-3.6TH.Thus you are likely the luckiest block hitter in the last 3 years.To scale the luck my mine has had 1.5ph to 2.0 ph last 3 years and we have not hit a block. we don't mine solo we mine pps and even with 200x the hash for last 3 years no block and about 1.131.035.007.23 coins to his 6.3 or so for the 1 block

comments.author: Sledge0001
comments.body: Quote from: yoshimitsu777 on November 23, 2022, 09:00:48 AMawesome!!!!!!congratulationsThey say even a blind squirrel gets a nut once in a while

comments.author: kano
comments.body: Well ... every single block is found by a single miner.Each block found on each pool is also found by one account on that pool.It doesn't really mean much to say that someone with a low hash rate found a block,since in reality that is how blocks are found.Or to put it another way One of Sledge's 390GH/s CompacF ferraris found a block ... and that is a single chip miner.

comments.author: mikeywith
comments.body: Quote from: philipma1957 on November 17, 2022, 03:34:28 PMTo scale the luck my mine has had 1.5ph to 2.0 ph last 3 years and we have not hit a block.How do you know your miners didn't hit any block when mining to those PPS pools? it's pretty hard to keep track unless you use monitoring software that gives you alerts when one of the miners hits a block, the miner log itself would reset with every reboot so your miners could very well have hit a couple of blocks without you knowing.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: mikeywith on December 05, 2022, 11:42:09 PMQuote from: philipma1957 on November 17, 2022, 03:34:28 PMTo scale the luck my mine has had 1.5ph to 2.0 ph last 3 years and we have not hit a block.How do you know your miners didn't hit any block when mining to those PPS pools? it's pretty hard to keep track unless you use monitoring software that gives you alerts when one of the miners hits a block, the miner log itself would reset with every reboot so your miners could very well have hit a couple of blocks without you knowing. I check a lot. but it is possible i missed one.

comments.author: Sledge0001
comments.body: Quote from: yoshimitsu777 on December 05, 2022, 07:23:29 AM it must have felt crazyOh you have no idea. I still laugh about me almost falling out of bed when I saw my wallet balance!

comments.author: RKG456
comments.body: Quote from: Sledge0001 on November 16, 2022, 05:37:06 PMQuote from: philipma1957 on November 16, 2022, 03:23:14 PMQuote from: NotFuzzyWarm on November 16, 2022, 02:48:42 PMEarlier this year a Compac-F running 350GHs hit a block on the -ck solo pool. Hence the name "TheOmen" but nothing more than a simple Windows PC a few high power hubs and some USB miners.  My total BTC farm hashpower at that time was between 8.2 - 9.2Th but the system that hit was running 9 Compac F sticks totaling about 3.4-3.6TH.I think it is awesome someone hit with the USB stick miners! Just curious, have you added more compacs since then? Are you getting any of the new R909 pod miners?Do you have any of them mining on kanopool as well to diversify or just put them all on ckpool for a higher hash rate?

comments.author: Sledge0001
comments.body: I'm currently running 40 Compac F's and 9x 2 Pacs on a private pool which is under development.  I do use CK'S and Kano's pools however both as backup pools. Both are great options.I'm not running any R909's at this time. I am however running several Apollo BTC's as well as and an ever expanding number of S19 Pros. Gotta keep hope alive!!!!

comments.author: RKG456
comments.body: Quote from: Sledge0001 on December 28, 2022, 05:01:39 AMI'm currently running 40 Compac F's and 9x 2 Pacs on a private pool which is under development.  I do use CK'S and Kano's pools however both as backup pools. Both are great options.I'm not running any R909's at this time. I am however running several Apollo BTC's as well as and an ever expanding number of S19 Pros. Gotta keep hope alive!!!!That's awesome.  Would love to see a picture or video of all that.  What is the total hashrate with all that running?

comments.author: Sledge0001
comments.body: Quote from: RKG456 on December 30, 2022, 01:27:27 AMQuote from: Sledge0001 on December 28, 2022, 05:01:39 AMI'm currently running 40 Compac F's and 9x 2 Pacs on a private pool which is under development.  I do use CK'S and Kano's pools however both as backup pools. Both are great options.I'm not running any R909's at this time. I am however running several Apollo BTC's as well as and an ever expanding number of S19 Pros. Gotta keep hope alive!!!!That's awesome.  Would love to see a picture or video of all that.  What is the total hashrate with all that running?Pi3 = 10 x Compac F's = 3.75 Th/sPi2 = 15 x Compac F's = 5.7 Th/sPi1 = 15 x Compac F's = 5.7 Th/sApollo1 = 6 x Apollo BTC (On Balanced) = 15Th/sApollo2 = 6 x Apollo BTC (On Balanced) = 15Th/sApollo3 = 4 x Apollo BTC (On Balanced) = 10Th/sApollo4 = 6 x Apollo BTC (On Balanced) = 15Th/sSingle Apollo = 1 x Apollo BTC (On Balanced) = 2.45Th/s S19APro110Th = 7 x 110Th = 770Th/sS19JPro104Th = 3 x 104Th = 312Th/sAdding this week or early next:1 x S19APro 110Th = 110Th/s6 x S19JPro 104Th = 624Th/sSo if all goes well next week I should be pushing about 1.88Ph/s

comments.author: Sledge0001
comments.body: Currently all solo on a pool that's under development.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: Sledge0001 on December 30, 2022, 04:01:39 AMCurrently all solo on a pool that's under development.I have been asked to not give info out on this pool so I will say 1 thing I am pointing 1 s19 pro to his pool.

comments.body: Quote from: philipma1957 on December 30, 2022, 01:35:16 PMQuote from: Sledge0001 on December 30, 2022, 04:01:39 AMCurrently all solo on a pool that's under development.I have been asked to not give info out on this pool so I will say 1 thing I am pointing 1 s19 pro to his pool.Actually I think its important to note that the pool which is under development is a joint effort between myself and another member of the forum.
